group_1.textLeft: And well, as for Juri the Great…@I’m unwillin’ to apologize to Torayamachi.
I mean, I had that girl’s word, and was burning in@the heat of the fight with my old man, and stuff.
Man, it was all real complicated.

group_1.textRight: Our failure to stop the inner movement@was a big problem, though.
Both of you warned us in advance,@but we were far too naive.
Never thought that the Ryuugasaki back then@would be that dissatisfied…
That being the case, I suppose it was quite@a bad idea for us to fight during that time…

group_1.textLeft: But if we hadn't fought,@Juri the Great mighta burst into flames.

group_1.textRight: And if Juri had gone berserk,@the system would’ve collapsed, no?
To me, it just seems like it was bound@to happen no matter what you did.

group_1.textLeft: It's just that this misfortune triggered other@defections, making stuff difficult.
Like, remember when you were crying like@a baby out at Monzenbashi Bat’s place?

group_1.textRight: I wasn’t crying like a BABY!
I had a lot going on at the time, you know,@with Ao and everything…!
I’ve been exploited by the Bat of@Monzenbashi a lot, too…

group_1.textLeft: I’m sorry, Ao…

group_1.textRight: Er, well, just like Ranka,@I don't think it could have been avoided, so…
Besides, the major cause of exploitation@is from Kamihama, anyway!

group_1.textLeft: That’s right…
At first, we were just fighting over a small division.
But after the Magius stole away our Witches,@it really turned into a Blood Tragedy.
True that;@the last few months were the toughest.

group_1.textRight: The one who killed the most was Juri, though…
I’m home…
Whoa, the side dishes sure look good today.@Lucky…

group_1.textLeft: Lucky my ass, you dumbass.

group_1.textRight: Ack…

group_1.textLeft: Called or not, this time’s way too late.

group_1.textRight: My bad…

group_1.textLeft: Look, I know you’ve been coming home late a lot@these days, but you ain’t messing around with any@weirdos, are ya…?

group_1.textRight: I kinda am, but it’s not like anything's@really gone south yet.

group_1.textLeft: Hey…@Don’t say such worrying stuff to me…

group_1.textRight: Old man, relax:@it’s all gonna settle down soon, hear?
There’s a fight for the future's sake—@something of that sort.
I’m gonna fill you in ‘bout it in a few months.

group_1.textLeft: …So you ain’t telling me now, asked or not.

group_1.textRight: Yup.

group_1.textLeft: Then, I oughta wait patiently.

group_1.textRight: It’s kinda a nostalgic story, but…
Today I was talking to a couple buddies about the@time I broke up with my homegirl over some beef.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, really? ‘Cause I was just talkin’ ‘bout@one of those days, too.
In my old job, I got frowned upon for tryin’ to win.
‘Cause the two companies were gettin’ along@just fine, and I stole that from them.

group_1.textRight: Oh, so that's why you quit back then, old man?
We're a lot alike, you and me.

group_1.textLeft: YOU resemble ME, Juri.
Hey, it’s gettin’ late, so why dontcha just eat?

group_1.textRight: I gotta take a bath before that.

group_1.textLeft: …By the way, you ain’t staying out late@‘cause of some man, right…?

group_1.textRight: Why would I bother with men when my@old man ain’t finding women?

group_1.textLeft: Look, you'd hate anyone I found,@wouldn'tcha...?!

group_1.textRight: Right, you gotta hold off for a bit@till I’m outta home.
I like being with my old man, y’know,@just the two of us.

group_1.textCenter: Victory comes first,@that’s all I’m saying!
